metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13063 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 has a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the function GetStyleTokens in coders/svg.c:314:12. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-13063` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-7
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-7
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-7
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-7
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-7').
